entry.title: SAP Joule Analytics Center, No Data to display
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have done the setup of SAP Joule with SuccessFactor and currently exploring Joule Analytics Center to know insights.

I am able to access center but there is no data to show PFB snip, when checked in inspect it says message: "Rejected due to too few users". As per limitation it says 8 minimum users are required, currently more than 10 users are using it still data is not being showed in analytics platform.

are there alternative ways or other options to understand why data is not displayed here?

any APIs available to get data?


Joule Data and Analytics Joule

entry.title: Enabling Joule on multiple SAP SuccessFactors instances
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am seeking clarification regarding the enablement of the Joule license on multiple SAP SuccessFactors instances (e.g., Test, Dev, and Prod).

From the SAP documentation, I understand that:

- "To set up a Joule Preview tenant, subaccounts must be in the EU10 or EU30 data centers; otherwise, it is not possible to add Joule Preview entitlements."
- "A single Joule subscription can be integrated with multiple SAP products but only with one tenant per product. Therefore, it is not possible to use a single Joule subscription across multiple tenants of the same product."


I would like to know:

1) If a subaccount is not located in the EU10 or EU30 data centers, how can Joule be enabled in Test or Preview environments?
2) Considering the requirement to enable Joule on three SAP SuccessFactors instances (Test, Dev, and Prod), how can this be achieved? Is it possible to use the Joule service on multiple instances? What is the recommended approach in such cases?

Thank you in advance to anyone who can provide guidance or share experiences on this topic.

entry.title: Unable to deploy Joule Skill in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content: Hi, I have setup Joule in our project. I am able to deploy the Joule Skill in SAP Build Process Automation. I have assigned all the roles ( including extensibility developer) to to my colleagues but they are not able to deploy Joule skill and also not able to launch it. They are getting an error saying 'Project cannot be deployed by the component 'Integration Gateway'. Project cannot be deployed in this environment because the user doesn't have the required "extensibility developer" role in Joule. Please contact your administrator to get the necessary permissions.

entry.title: Capture Correlation-ID in Joule
entry.content:
Capture Correlation-ID in Joule

Use the steps below to capture the Correlation ID in Joule, which is required for troubleshooting and providing details to the SAP Support team.

Step 1: Log in to SuccessFactors using the Chrome browser.

 

Step 2: Right-click and select Inspect.

 

 

Step 3: In Developer Tools, go to the Network tab.

 

 




Step 4: Launch Joule and enter the use case. In the Developer Tools, you will see the flower brackets. Select the latest log, which appears at the bottom, and click on it.

 

 

 

Step 5: You will see the Headers. Click on it, and at the bottom you can find the X-Correlation ID.

entry.title: MCP Server Tool Test Fails in Joule Agent with 6010 Error
entry.content:
Hello Team,

I am facing an issue while testing an MCP server tool in the Joule Agent and would appreciate your guidance.

Scenario

I have implemented an MCP server using FastMCP with a custom tool that executes a SPARQL query against SAP HANA Knowledge Graph. The server runs in streamable-http mode.

Observations

  • The MCP server starts successfully.

  • All tools are listed correctly when the MCP server is registered.
  • The tool metadata is visible and selectable in the Joule Agent.
  • However, when I configure the Destination and attempt to test the tool, the test fails with Error 6010.

Key Point

The same MCP server and tool work correctly when tested locally and are properly displayed in the MCP server. The failure only occurs during destination-based testing in the Joule Agent.

Environment

  • MCP Framework: FastMCP

  • Transport: streamable-http

  • Backend: SAP HANA Cloud (Knowledge Graph / SPARQL)

  • Authentication: Destination-based

  • Error: 6010 during tool test

Question

  • What does error 6010 indicate in the context of Joule Agent MCP destination testing?

  • Are there any specific requirements for:

    • MCP endpoint structure

    • Response format

    • Authentication headers

    • Health or metadata endpoints

  • Is additional configuration required for FastMCP‚Äìbased servers to be compatible with Joule Agent destinations?

Any guidance or documentation references would be very helpful.

sap-joule-studio-mcp-server:true property added in destination
"
import os
import json
import logging
from typing import Dict, Any

from hdbcli import dbapi
from mcp.server.fastmcp import FastMCP

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)

# --------------------------------------------------
# MCP Server
# --------------------------------------------------
mcp = FastMCP(
    name="sap-hana-kg-mcp",
    host="0.0.0.0",
    port=int(os.getenv("PORT", 8080)),
)

# --------------------------------------------------
# HANA Connection via VCAP_SERVICES
# --------------------------------------------------
def get_hana_connection():
    #vcap = json.loads(os.environ["VCAP_SERVICES"])
    #hana = vcap["hana"][0]["credentials"]

    return dbapi.connect(
        user="DBADMIN",
        password="password@2103",
        address="address",
        port=443,
        encrypt="true",
        sslValidateCertificate="true",
    )

# --------------------------------------------------
# Utility: JSON-safe rows
# --------------------------------------------------
def serialize_rows(rowsüòû
    return [
        [str(col) if col is not None else None for col in row]
        for row in rows
    ]

# --------------------------------------------------
# MCP Tool
# --------------------------------------------------
@mcp.tool(
    description="Execute a SPARQL query against SAP HANA Knowledge Graph and return results"
)
def execute_sparql(query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    """
    Input:
      - query: SPARQL query string

    Output:
      - status, row_count, results
    """
    try:
        GRAPH_URI = "http://new_test_mission_faqhanahotspots.org/"

        conn = get_hana_connection()
        cursor = conn.cursor()

        cursor.callproc(
            "SPARQL_EXECUTE",
            (
                query,
                "Query from Joule MCP",
                GRAPH_URI,
                None,
            ),
        )

        rows = cursor.fetchall()

        cursor.close()
        conn.close()

        return {
            "status": "success",
            "row_count": len(rows),
            "results": serialize_rows(rows[:10]),
        }

    except Exception as e:
        import traceback
        return {
            "status": "error",
            "message": str(e),
            "trace": traceback.format_exc(),
        }



# --------------------------------------------------
# Run MCP
# --------------------------------------------------
if __name__ == "__main__":
    mcp.run(
        transport="streamable-http" )
"

 

Thank you for your support.

entry.title: I need a POV using Joule via BTP, but keeping data and execution on-prem or in NS2.
entry.content:
I need a POV using Joule via BTP, but keeping data and execution on-prem or in NS2.  Here is my answer, wanted review of my pov.

POV

1. Architecture Approach

  • Hybrid Model:
    • Joule UI & orchestration via SAP BTP (public cloud).
    • Data & execution remain on-prem or NS2 using:
      • SAP AI Core/AI Foundation deployed in NS2 or on-prem.
      • Secure connectors (SAP Cloud Connector, Private Link) for controlled interaction.
  • Inference Strategy:
    • Joule prompts processed in BTP but routed to local AI runtime for execution.
    • Sensitive data never leaves NS2/on-prem; only metadata or anonymized context flows to BTP.

2. Key Benefits

  • Compliance & Sovereignty:
    • Meets FedRAMP, ITAR, and other regulatory requirements.
  • Performance & Latency:
    • Local execution reduces dependency on public cloud for heavy workloads.
  • Innovation Access:
    • Still leverages Joule‚Äôs capabilities without compromising security.

3. Challenges

  • Integration Complexity:
    • Requires robust connectivity and governance between BTP and NS2/on-prem.
  • Feature Parity:
    • Some Joule features may depend on public cloud AI services; need fallback or custom models locally.
  • Cost & Maintenance:
    • Running AI Core locally adds infrastructure overhead.

4. Recommended Actions

  • Assess Use Cases:
    • Identify which Joule scenarios require sensitive data handling.
  • Deploy AI Core in NS2:
    • Use SAP AI Core/AI Foundation for local inference.
  • Implement Secure Connectivity:
    • SAP Cloud Connector + Private Link for controlled communication.
  • Governance Framework:
    • Define data classification, prompt filtering, and audit mechanisms.

Key Components

  1. Joule Interface
    Embedded in SAP applications (e.g., S/4HANA, SuccessFactors) for user interaction.

  2. SAP BTP (Public Cloud)
    Acts as the orchestration layer for Joule, handling prompt routing and metadata exchange.

  3. Secure Connectivity

    • SAP Cloud Connector and Private Link ensure encrypted, controlled communication between BTP and NS2/on-prem systems.

  4. On-Prem/NS2 AI Runtime

    • SAP AI Core/AI Foundation deployed locally for inference and processing.
    • Sensitive data never leaves the secure environment.

  5. ERP Systems (S/4HANA, ECC)
    Hosted in NS2/on-prem for transactional and operational data.

  6. Compliance & Governance Layer

    • Enforces FedRAMP, ITAR, and other regulatory standards.
    • Includes audit, logging, and prompt filtering.

Data Flow

  • User ‚Üí Joule ‚Üí BTP ‚Üí Secure Connector ‚Üí NS2 AI Core ‚Üí ERP Systems
  • Only metadata or anonymized context flows to BTP; all sensitive data and execution remain local.

Benefits

  • Regulatory Compliance: Meets strict security and sovereignty requirements.
  • Innovation Access: Leverages Joule without compromising sensitive data.
  • Performance: Local execution reduces latency for critical workloads.

entry.title: SAP Joule Integration with SuccessFactors (Custom & Standard Portlet Support)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

We are currently in the final phase of implementing SAP Joule with SAP SuccessFactors and are preparing for an upcoming go-live. During our testing and validation cycles, we have identified critical limitations that are impacting our Joule use cases and overall readiness.

We are submitting this as a High Priority Enhancement Request, as the issues directly affect business adoption and scope finalization.

Issue 1: Lack of Support for Custom Portlets / Custom MDF Objects

Description:
Our SuccessFactors landscape includes several custom portlets and custom MDF objects that store critical employee and business data. Currently, SAP Joule is unable to retrieve, interpret, or respond with information from these custom portlets.

We have reviewed the official Joule implementation and configuration guides; however, we did not find any documented configuration, extensibility option, or workaround that allows Joule to consume data from custom portlets or MDF objects.

Business Impact:

  • Limits Joule‚Äôs usability to only a subset of standard data
  • Prevents adoption of Joule for organization-specific use cases
  • Reduces ROI on Joule implementation
  • Forces continued manual navigation and reporting for custom data

Request / Enhancement Ask:

  1. Please confirm whether SAP Joule currently supports custom portlets or custom MDF objects.
  2. If supported:
    • Kindly share the required configuration steps, permissions, APIs, or extensibility options.
  3. If not supported:
    • Please advise on the product roadmap for custom object support.
    • Suggest any recommended alternative approach to expose custom data for Joule-based use cases.

Issue 2: Joule Not Working for Certain Standard SuccessFactors Portlets

Description:
We have also identified that Joule is not functioning as expected for the following standard SuccessFactors portlets:

  • Bank Information
  • Dependent Information

Despite these being standard delivered portlets, Joule does not return, process, or interact with data from these areas during testing.

Business Impact:

  • Incomplete employee self-service experience
  • Limits Joule‚Äôs effectiveness for HR and employee queries
  • Creates inconsistencies across supported and unsupported data domains

Request / Enhancement Ask:

  1. Please validate whether Bank Information and Dependent Information portlets are officially supported by Joule.
  2. Share any required prerequisites, role-based permissions, or configuration settings needed to enable Joule functionality for these portlets.
  3. Confirm whether this behavior is:
    • A known issue
    • A documented product limitation
    • Planned for enhancement in upcoming releases

Priority & Go-Live Impact

Given our upcoming go-live, clarity on the above items is critical for:

  • Finalizing Joule use cases
  • Managing business expectations
  • Determining scope and adoption readiness

We would appreciate your guidance, confirmation, and any available documentation or roadmap insights at the earliest.

Thank you for your continued support. We look forward to your response.

entry.title: SAP Joule Agent with SAP oData MCP Issue
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are trying to create an SAP Joule Agent with MCP

We have followed steps for developing the same using following blog on SAP oData mcp

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/sap-odata-to-mcp-server-running-on-btp/ba-p/14220561

  1. Accordingly, we have imported the project from GitHub
  2. We have configured destinations accordingly for SAP on premise S/4HANA system
  3. Built and deployed the MCP successfully on BTP Subaccount
  4. We have also created a destination in subaccount to access above mcp server

   https://help.sap.com/docs/Joule_Studio/45f9d2b8914b4f0ba731570ff9a85313/3d9dfad0bc39468292d508f0808a12fe.html

 

  1. We have created SAP joule agent accordingly
  2. And trying to add / configure the mcp server
  3. However, while adding its showing below mentioned error after selecting the destinations -

Unable to find MCP server tools for destination

Unable to find MCP server tools for destination XXXXXXXXXXX. The destination tried to provide authorization tokens but failed in all cases. This is most likely due to misconfiguration. Original error messages: Bad credentials

 

  1. We tried all the possible types in destination service eg. OAuth2Password, OAuth2ClientCredentials , OAuth2JWTBearer , OAuth2TokenExchange but still we are getting the error relevant to authorization
  2. How to resolve this issue, what kind of destination authentication we should use for this?

Regards,

 

Nilesh Rane

entry.title: Issues with Joule AI on SAP SuccessFactors Test Instance & Customization of AI Instructions
entry.content:
Issues with Joule AI behavior and customization options

We have tested several times the Joule  Joule AI implemented on our SAP SuccessFactor test instance, and we are repeatedly facing error messages such as:

  • ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, but I can‚Äôt‚Ä¶‚Äù

  • "I am unable to ..."
  • ‚ÄúThis action is not available at the moment‚Äù

(see screenshot attached below)

Could you please explain why these messages appear? We would like to understand whether this is related to system configuration, authorizations, current limitations of Joule, or the test environment.

In addition, we would like to know if it is possible to customize Joule‚Äôs instructions or responses.
For example, when asking ‚ÄúHow can I create a job requisition?‚Äù, Joule provides the standard SAP SuccessFactors procedure, whereas we would like it to return our internal company process instead.

Is it possible to modify or configure Joule so that it uses company-specific procedures or documentation rather than the default SAP SuccessFactors guidance?

Finally, could you please let us know how to formally submit or escalate enhancement / evolution requests related to Joule AI (e.g. new functionalities, customization capabilities, or improvements)?

Thank you in advance.
